title: Helvetica NOW poster contest...
content:
Did anybody here know that Linotype organized a poster contest for the 50th anniversary of Helvetica?

(A search on Google didn’t turn up any links to Typophile...)

Anyway, I just found a link to the winning entries:

[http://www.linotype.com/3412/helveticanowpostercontest.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704154903/http:/www.linotype.com/3412/helveticanowpostercontest.html "http://www.linotype.com/3412/helveticanowpostercontest.html")

 [‹ Need advice - Ink Jet Printer](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704154903/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41045 "Go to previous forum topic") [E Zines similar to Bak Magazine ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704154903/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41075 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Ricardo Cordoba

comments.content:
To keep updated on Lino-Happenings you can subscribe to the Linoletter...

[http://www.linotype.com/en/5244/linoletter200801.html?PHPSESSID=e9a3dc97...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704154903/http:/www.linotype.com/en/5244/linoletter200801.html?PHPSESSID=e9a3dc97369c5812a7468465e2c1a321 "http://www.linotype.com/en/5244/linoletter200801.html?PHPSESSID=e9a3dc97369c5812a7468465e2c1a321")
Another 50 print helvetica thing. Probably posted before. I really like some of [these](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704154903/http:/www.blanka.co.uk/Design/50_Exhibition).
There’s some pretty blatant design “appropriation” in that linotype contest....
